intro: Galium hintoniorum, commonly known as Hinton's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the United Kingdom. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium hintoniorum is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a rare and localized species.
